problems.title: Loss of Suction
problems.description: Henry isn't smiling (picking up dirt) as well as he used to.
solution_steps: Beat the large white Tritex filter (the round disc) outside to remove dust.
Check the black hose for splits.

problems.title: Hose Split
solution_steps: The standard Henry hose is robust but can split near the cuffs.

faqs.question: Is it worth fixing the suction on a Henry (HVR160 / HVR200)?
faqs.answer: Yes. A replacement filter or seal typically costs significantly less than a new $591 vacuum, and extending the life of your Numatic is eco-friendly.

faqs.question: How do I know if my Henry (HVR160 / HVR200) needs a new filter or seal?
faqs.answer: Common signs include strange noises and the device failing to complete a cleaning cycle.

faqs.question: Can I replace the filter or seal on my Henry (HVR160 / HVR200) myself?
faqs.answer: Yes, this is a user-serviceable repair. Most replacements generally require just a screwdriver and about 10-20 minutes of time.
